Topic.Title: Bezos sells $200 million worth of AMZN stock

Message.Msg: Wait until all the other Amazon significant insiders realize that capital gains for them ARE going up for them. They don't have $20B in funny money, so they will all take a very significant portion off the table as soon as it become clear that they'll be losing between 5% and 8.8% of the current total value (actually much more since longer term this will get cut in half).

Topic.Title: Bezos sells $200 million worth of AMZN stock

Message.Msg: I cannot think of one good reason to remain long on this stock right now. There have been huge gains, it sits at 52w high levels, FWD P/E over 100, valuation vs its peers is at an all-time high, capital gains are going up massively, potential recession looms. In fact you would have to expect this stock to appreciate more than 10% next year just breakeven on taxes, when it is already technically way overbought. So you have economic, policy, technical and fundametal reasons to sell.

Topic.Title: "Sharktooth" distribution chart followed by "Amazon Falls"?

Message.Msg: Boy are you wrong about that. Charts and technicals in the short term absolutely do work as short-term predictors regardless of long range fundamentals. Do some research on elliot wave theory and fibanacci retracement, arcs and fans. The investor that combines the two (long-range fundamentals and short term technicals) has the best chance for success.

Message.Title: Amazon. 1/8th the revenue of Wal-Mart. 1/2 the market cap of Wal-Mart
Message.Msg: Amazon will have its day of reckoning. I'm trying to call the inflection point when the momentum traders all bail on it and it starts its 80% correction down. Right now Amazon has just 1/8th the revenue yet is about 1/2 the market cap of Wal-mart. Wal-Mart trailing EPS also over 60 times Amazon's. So with 60 times more earnings Wal-Mart trades for just double the market cap of Amazon. So either Amazon is wildly overvalued or Wal-mart absurdly undervalued. It is clear to everyone that it is the former and amazon is nothing but a casino stock for day traders and momentum traders. However once the music stops we see what happens like Netflix or Green Mountain. What will stop the casino stock move and begin the shakeout? Not sure but when it comes it's going to be wildly profitable for the shorts, especially ones highly levered in PUT contracts.

Topic.Title: They will WARN after the bell..Open $215 tomorrow...careful

Message.Msg: They warned on the conference call of their last financials that the 4th quarter would not be profitable. The funny thing is that with high overhead profitability should be less with volume unless they have negative margins and/or too much overhead. So if they lose money in the 4th quarter when their assets are utilized more efficiently, what does that say to the 1st quarter. There only hope is world domination coupled with vertical integration.
